name: Shellycoat
description: The Shellycoat is a medium-sized fey creature that can thrive both in water and on land. It has a slimy exterior and possesses natural armor.
memorable: Can regenerate hit points and is vulnerable to sunlight which can petrify it.
goals: To ambush and hinder intruders in its watery domain.
relations: Related to other fey creatures and large aquatic beings.
environment: Commonly found in aquatic environments or near water bodies.
strengths: Regeneration allows it to recover hit points, particularly effective in water due to camouflage.
weaknesses: Sunlight petrifies it and it is vulnerable to fire and acid damage.
attacks: Can bite to deal piercing damage and slash with claws while grappling opponents.
most_powerful_ability: The Shellycoat’s Fog ability creates heavily obscured fog and can poison intruders.
senses: Has keen hearing, gaining advantage on perception checks based on sound.
skills: Skilled in Stealth, making it capable of remaining undetected while submerged.
additional_information: Immune to being charmed, poisoned, or unconscious.
Can breathe both air and water due to amphibious ability.
Regeneration ceases if damaged by acid or fire.
Ability to see through fog, smoke, and steam enhances combat effectiveness.
Grapples opponents with claw attacks, restraining them.
test_queries: creature that regenerates but hates sunlight
medium-sized fey that can become petrified
water camouflage monster with claw attacks
